summary: This document is an email from a self-identified victim of the Epstein sex trafficking ring, dated December 8, 2023, urgently requesting their NHS hospital records. The writer claims the records from August 2008 will prove an 'Epstein accomplice' committed acts against them that could constitute attempted murder, and are vital to ongoing international investigations.

persons.name: Epstein Accomplice
persons.context: Unnamed individual alleged by the email writer to have committed acts against them that could be attempted murder, connected to the Epstein sex trafficking ring.

persons.name: Mum
persons.context: The writer's mother, who reportedly informed the writer that they had to be resuscitated multiple times during the August 2008 hospital incident.

connections.description: The writer alleges the 'Epstein accomplice' committed acts against them that resulted in a near-fatal hospitalization.

events.title: Alleged Abduction and Hospitalization
events.description: The email writer states they were 'picked up' at a cemetery opposite their home and taken to St Thomas Hospital. They were resuscitated multiple times, were in a coma, contracted pneumonia and MRSA, and nearly died, remaining in ICU.

locations: St Thomas Hospital Emergency Hospital, Lambeth Palace Road SE1 7EH
Cemetery opposite the writer's former home address (address not specified in text)
keyFacts: The writer identifies as a victim of the Epstein sex trafficking ring.
The writer alleges an 'Epstein accomplice' was responsible for a near-fatal incident on August 16, 2008, that required hospitalization, resuscitation, and resulted in a coma.
The writer claims their hospital records are vital evidence for ongoing international investigations and could support a charge of attempted murder.
The document is a 2023 request for 2008 NHS records, indicating the case remains active for the writer.
The writer implies their safety or time is limited, stating 'I don't have much time left.'
